resources.string: Privacy Indicators

When this service is enabled it lets \'Privacy Indicators App\' to display notifications and indicators every time a third-party app or a service uses camera or microphone on any screen. \n\nThis Service/App doesn\'t have any permission to use internet or your device\'s camera, microphone or any other Hardware. And will NOT gather any data whatsoever.
Get notified every time a third-party app uses camera or microphone
Made with ‚ù§ by Nitish
Built in FOSS HACKS 2020
You will get an active notification on the status bar while an app is using your camera or microphone.
Click on the above Switch and Turn on the Privacy Indicator in the Accessibility Settings
Privacy Indicators are disabled
Camera Indicator
This feature toggle will enable Camera Indicator which will notify you every time when a third-party app or service tried to access your Camera Hardware.
Microphone Indicator
This feature toggle will enable Microphone Indicator which will notify you every time when a third-party app or service tried to access your Microphone.
Location Indicator
GPS Hardware usage indicator. This feature is still under development. Will be functional from next release.
Vibration Alert
Turning this on will give you a haptic feedback to indicate camera and microphone usage of any third-party app or service.
Notification Alert
Turning this on will give you a foreground notification when ever the camera or microphone usage is detected.
Customize Indicators
You can customise how, where and which indicators to be appeared. Configure the look and feel of Indicators
Indicator Logs
View the summary of Camera, Microphone and Location usage by various apps. Arranged in chronological order and statistically displayed. (Inspired from Android 12)
Share with your friends
Spread the power of privacy control to your friends and also rate us on Play store if you feel this app useful.
Report Issue or Request Feature
This app is completely open-source. If you have any issue or willing to request a feature click here to go to GitHub repo.
